thread.title: inMotionNow Makes Select List of Showcase Companies Again at CED Tech Venture Conference
thread.title_full: inMotionNow Makes Select List of Showcase Companies Again at CED Tech Venture Conference

author: Shanna Oskin
title: inMotionNow Makes Select List of Showcase Companies Again at CED Tech Venture Conference
text:
inMotionNow ( http://www.inmotionnow.com ), a provider of work management solutions for marketing and creative teams, has been selected as one of 14 showcase companies to be featured on the main stage at this year's CED Tech Venture Conference 2015 representing North Carolina's hottest emerging technology companies. Considered the “best of the best,” showcase companies were selected by the Council for Entrepreneurial Development (CED) to tell their story on the main stage in front of over 800 attendees at a conference that has become a “Who’s Who” of the nation’s technology industry — from the most exciting emerging tech companies to the most influential investors and tech leaders. inMotionNow’s creative work management solution, inMotion, helps marketing and design teams who struggle to manage creative production demands. The SaaS solution provides traditional project management functionality – like task management, deadlines, and project status tracking – seamlessly integrated with features that meet the unique needs of creative teams: online proofing for soliciting feedback on creative work and online project requests for managing client requests for new work. Key customers include marketing and creative services teams at national brands (DuPont), retailers (CarMax), healthcare organizations (Blue Cross Blue Shield), media and entertainment companies (Electronic Arts), interactive agencies (Publicis), professional sports teams (Miami Dolphins) and non-profits (Habitat for Humanity).
As a showcase company, inMotionNow CEO Ben Hartmere will demonstrate the company’s unique value proposition, continued growth, and tremendous potential. In addition to the onstage presentation, inMotionNow joins more than 80 companies invited to demonstrate their technologies in a Demo Room at the conference.
“Our team at inMotionNow is very proud of our success to-date and we believe that our growth will only continue to accelerate,” says Hartmere. “We are honored and excited to be selected yet again as a CED Tech Venture Conference showcase company. I think the CED community will be impressed with what inMotionNow and our clients have accomplished in the past year.”
inMotionNow’s showcase company presentation will be delivered at 4:30pm on September 15th at 5pm on the main stage at the 2015 CED Tech Venture Conference. inMotionNow will also be exhibiting in the conference Demo Room, Sept. 15-16 at the Raleigh Convention Center.
About CED and the CED Tech Venture Conference
CED is the largest and longest-running network for entrepreneurs in the country. CED’s network propels emerging Triangle companies into highly successful businesses. Members include a wide range of startup and growth stage companies, investors, corporate partners, academics, service providers, and individuals interested in benefiting from CED’s powerfully connected network.
As the premier tech event in the Southeast, the CED Tech Venture Conference reflects the vibrant entrepreneurial community that exists in one of the nation’s rising technology hubs, attracting over 800 entrepreneurs, investors, corporate leaders and domain experts from across the nation. The 2015 conference theme features companies that are "Scaling Up" and will be held Sept. 15-16 at the Raleigh Convention Center.
About inMotionNow
inMotionNow solves project management, creative brief, review and approval, and reporting challenges for marketing and creative teams with its work management application, inMotion. With inMotion, teams can automate administrative tasks that typically distract content creators from getting their content to market faster. inMotion gives marketing and creative teams what they need to ease the launch of new projects, solve visibility and accountability issues during project execution, speed the approval of new content, and surface actionable insights.
